text: hi I'm Alyssa Clark from the dining
section there are so many ways to
caramelize garlic and I am going to show
you the fastest the method that I'm
going to show you is a bit of a cheat in
that it's not the traditional long
roasted thoroughly caramelized garlic
that we're used to only the outside
really caramelizes but the inside still
softens and turns really sweet and you
know what it takes seven minutes instead
of an hour first thing you want to do is
prepare your garlic for the pan I've got
some nice big fat unpeeled garlic cloves
I'm gonna smash them with my knife and
I'm gonna peel them and the Smashing
here is crucial you really want to get
in there and smash the clove and break
it up a little bit then if you want to
trim off any little hard stems at the
bottom you can just go ahead and do that
no heat up about a quarter inch of olive
oil in your pan and then you're gonna
add the garlic you can get away with an
eighth of an inch but that garlicky oil
is so good you should save it use it in
salad dressings drizzle it on pasta it's
really worth it then just saute it on
medium heat you don't want to go too
high you don't want the garlic to burn
you want it to thoroughly caramelize on
the outside and soft it on the inside it
takes about five or six minutes if you
want to you could salt the oil will give
the garlic a little flavor but you don't
have to do sometimes I'll talk to
anchovies into the pan because I put
anchovies and everything so you'll have
an anchovy garlic oil so when the garlic
is golden brown all over but not too
Brown you don't want it burnt just use a
slotted spoon and take it out of the oil
if you're gonna use the garlic right
away you should store the oil separately
just put it in a jar it'll keep in the
fridge for at least a couple of weeks
but if you want to keep the garlic you
should just pour the oil right over the
garlic the oil helps preserve it and
then it'll keep in the fridge then you
can use the shooter's caramelize garlic
anyplace you'd use traditional roasted
garlic
you can use it to top pizza smear it on
crostini rub it all over lamb toss it in
the salad add it to pasta it's so good
and you saw so fast
